content.text: Fixing the insole on the last aims at centering it, so that the contour overlaps exactly over the contour of the last, and its surface corresponds the surface of the sole of the shoe.

Via conditioning the uppers the process of spatial formation is encourage, reducing the stresses to which the materials that structure the uppers are subjected, and the strength of the seams is increased.
The pulling of the uppers  is carried out in order to form the uppers spatially and to fix them permanently to the insole
The purpose of backpart pre-moulding is to pretension the uppers in order to prepare the lasting allowance to grip the machine's clamps.
The uppers are gathered at the heel seat, fixing the allowance by gluing or by tacks. The moulding of the semi-product in this area is done by a combined action of stretching and compressing.
Roughing and brushing of the sole surface is carried out to remove excess material and prepare the footwear for better contact with the adhesives.

The sole is glued to the shoe by pressing. Pressing the sole to the footwear can be done immediately after overlapping or, in the case of bonding with activation, immediately after activation and contact

Finishing operations on the sole/heel include: milling the edge of the sole, sanding leather soles/heels, dyeing, waxing, beading, heel carving, cleaning the edge and heel. Finishing operations on the uppers may include: washing and cleaning, pressing, waxing, cutting or singeing the ends of the thread, ironing.
